question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

The handsome profit from her fish business made Mrs. Uba stop complaining about her husband's ..........salary
explanation:
Handsome; substantial, large in size

meagre; scanty, inadequate, small

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

The media houses should employ both the novice and the............journalist
explanation:
Novice; a person new to and inexperienced in a job or situation.

veteran; a person who has had long experience in a particular field.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

Cheif Osa prefers fame in the village to............in the city
explanation:
fame; the state of being known or talked about by many people, especially on account of notable achievements.

obscurity; the state of being unknown, inconspicuous, or unimportant.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
While the Registrar considers the matter insignificant his deputy sees it as.............
explanation:
Insignificant; too small or unimportant to be worth consideration.

Crucial;  of great importance.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
It pays to be firm rather than..........in a case like this.
explanation:
firm; strongly felt and unlikely to change.

flexible; ready and able to change so as to adapt to different circumstances.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
The man's first wife is loyal while second is............
explanation:
Loyal; giving or showing firm and constant support or allegiance to a person or institution.

unfaithful; not adhering to vows, allegiance, or duty

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.

Rather than convict him, the impartial judge........him.
explanation:
Convict;  declare (someone) to be guilty of a criminal offence by the verdict of a jury or the decision of a judge in a court of law.

Acquitted; free (someone) from a criminal charge by a verdict of not guilty.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
Instead of reconciling her parents, Roxanne worked hard at..................them
explanation:
Reconciling; restore friendly relations between.

separating; cause to move or be apart.

question:
In each of the following sentences, there is one word underlined and one gap. From the list of words lettered A - D, choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to the underlined word and that will, at the same time, correctly fill the gap in the sentences.
We thought that Uncle Sam's health had improved but it had rather................
explanation: Deteriorated; become progressively worse.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

One very important aspect of human relationship is.................trust.
explanation:
One very important aspect of human relationship is mutual trust.

mutual; (of a feeling or action) experienced or done by each of two or more parties towards the other or others.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The two tasks were performed........................and we were able to finish early.
explanation:
The two tasks were performed simultaneously and we were able to finish early.

simultaneously; at the same time.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The two tasks were performed........................and we were able to finish early.
explanation:
The two tasks were performed simultaneously and we were able to finish early.

simultaneously; at the same time.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
The committee is charged with finding a .......solution to the crisis
explanation: The committee is charged with finding a  lasting solution to the crisis

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
We are worried by the............that exists between the two factions of the party
explanation:
We are worried by the rivalry that exists between the two factions of the party

Rivalry; competition for the same objective or for superiority in the same field.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Our teacher was not speaking.................when he said that the bursar was under a cloud
explanation:
Our teacher was not speaking literally when he said that the bursar was under a cloud

literally; used for emphasis while not being literally true.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The signature on the document lacked..............so it was rejected
explanation:
The signature on the document lacked authenticity so it was rejected

Authenticity; the quality of being authentic.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
Everyone could tell that Binta was happy from the .............on her face.
explanation:
Everyone could tell that Binta was happy from the expression on her face.

Expression; a look on someone's face that conveys a particular emotion.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
His last novel was........by his visit to the prisons
explanation:
His last novel was inspired by his visit to the prisons

Inspired; give rise to.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

As a result of the power cut, production at the paint factory came to a ...................
explanation:
As a result of the power cut, production at the paint factory came to a stand still

Stand still; remain fixed or immobile

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
James and Henry were at daggers drawn when I knew them. This means that they
explanation: Be bitterly hostile towards each other.
options: were always angry with each other

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
My book has become dog-eared through use. This means that
explanation: Fold down the corner of (a page of a book or magazine)
options: the corners of the pages of my book are crumpled
my book is designed like dog's ears

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
Musa does not believe that there is poverty in Africa; he is a dyed-in-the-wool capitalist. This means that Musa is
explanation: unchanging in a particular belief or opinion

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
Whenever my cousin comes to realize that I am telling the truth, she will eat the humble pie. This means that my cousin will
explanation: make a humble apology and accept humiliation.

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
I had dinner with Tony and Nick and they talked shop the whole time. This means that they talked
explanation: To discuss one's trade or job in depth, especially with someone who is in the same profession
options: about buying things from the shop

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
His decision to reconcile with his former agent paid off. This means that the reconciliation
explanation: yield good results; succeed.
options: cost him a lot of money

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
The beauty of Bimpe's garden shows that she has green fingers. This means that Bimpe
explanation: If someone has green fingers, they are very good at gardening and their plants grow well.
options: turns everything she touches to green

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
I would have visited you but for my father's ill health. This means that my
explanation: He couldn't visit because of his father's ill health
options: father's ill health would have made me to visit you
father's ill health prevented me from visting you
father's threatened to fall ill if I visited you
father did not fall ill, so I couldn't visit you

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
Her husband's death has forced her to tighten her belt. This means that she has
explanation: To cut one's expenditure; live more frugally.

question:
After each of the following sentences, a list of possible interpretations of the sentence is given. Choose the interpretation that you consider most appropriate for each sentence.
Some candidates takes examinations in their stride.This means that they
explanation: Taking something in someone's stride basically means to ​deal with a ​problem or ​difficulty ​calmly and not to ​allow it to ​influence what you are doing:

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

The provocation had an instantaneous effect on him.
explanation: Instantaneous; occurring or done instantly

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

I woke up feeling rather queer
explanation: Queer; strange; odd.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

If he declines the offer, it will be better for him.
explanation: Declines; politely refuse (an invitation or offer).

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

Our club encourages benevolence
explanation: Benevolence; the quality of being well meaning; kindness.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

Such utterances are inimical to the peaceful co-existence of the two communities
explanation: Inimical; tending to obstruct or harm. unfriendly; hostile.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

The chairman observed that Andrew was the most qualified candidate for the job
explanation: Qualified;  competent or knowledgeable enough to do something.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

What do you intend to do with these inanimate objects?
explanation: Inanimate; not alive.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

Everybody noticed that the chairman's excuse was lame
explanation: Lame;  unconvincingly feeble, weak

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

The president appointed staunch supporters of his policies as advisers.
explanation: staunch;  very loyal and committed in attitude. Trust worthy.

question:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word that is nearest in meaning to the underlined word.

The little boy gave his candid opinion of the incident.
explanation: candid; truthful and straightforward; frank.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Why are you always jealous.............other people?
explanation:
Why are you always jealous of other people?

Of; expressing the relationship between a part and a whole

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
It is sad that the rich...............pity the poor
explanation: It is sad that the rich don't pity the poor

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

It is sad that the rich...............pity the poor
explanation: It is sad that the rich don't pity the poor.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The motorcycle nearly hit Jane and..............
explanation:
The motorcycle nearly hit Jane and me

The subject or the doer of the action is 'the motorcycle'. The receiver of the action is 'Jane and me'.

'Me' is the object form of the pronoun 'i' as 'mine' is the possessive form of 'i'

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

I found my friends sitting..............the beach.
explanation:
I found my friends sitting at the beach.

If you say "at'' the beach, it might be in the water, or at a shop near the beach buying ice cream, or even on vacation in a beach town.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
It is about time you..............to bed.
explanation:
It is about time you went to bed.

Tense is the form of a verb which represents the time it takes for something to happen. It is of three types: "Past, present and future". Past refers something that already happened, present refers to thing that is happening right now and future indicates to the things that are yet to happen.

The above given sentence is changed into past tense by changing the verb into past form.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

It is about time you..............to bed.
explanation:
It is about time you went to bed.

The grammar is past but meaning is NOW

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

One of his close friends...............a soldier
explanation:
One of his close friends is a soldier

When deciding whether to use is or are, look at whether the noun is plural or singular. The noun ''soldier'' is singular

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Does Omar...........in the city?
explanation:
Does Omar live in the city?

Live; reside, one's residence

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The meeting of the.................will come later today.
explanation:
The meeting of the secretaries general will come later today.

secretaries general is the plural form of secretary general

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
His father has a .............
explanation: His father has a beautiful round wooden table

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The teachers don't teach us............?
explanation: The teachers don't teach us, do they?

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

We are no...........friends
explanation:
We are no longer friends.

No longer; not any more.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Can you tell us how the accident came...............?
explanation:
Can you tell us how the accident came about.

When you say how or when something came about, you say how or when it happened.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

She wondered if the water was not..............hot for drinking
explanation:
She wondered if the water was not too hot for drinking.

Too; to a higher degree than is desirable, permissible, or possible; excessively.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The robbers were subjected..............a thorough beating by the irate mob.
explanation: The robbers were subjected to a thorough beating by the irate mob.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The cook should have.............the pepper and the tomatoes together
explanation:
The cook should have.............the pepper and the tomatoes together

Ground is the only standard conjugation of this verb grind. The verb grind is usually inflected ground in the past tense and as a past participle

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

My friends would not believe me If I............ them this story
explanation:
My friends would not believe me If I told them this story,

Because the speaker used ''would'' (past tense of will), the correct option will be in its past tense too. ''Told'' is therefore the correct option

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Even before his burial, Okoye's family members were already planning how to share his wealth...........themselves.
explanation:
Even before his burial, Okoye's family members were already planning how to share his wealth among themselves.

Among; being a member or members of (a larger set).

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Even before his burial, Okoye's family members were already planning how to share his wealth...........themselves.
explanation:
Even before his burial, Okoye's family members were already planning how to share his wealth among themselves.

Among; being a member or members of (a larger set).

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The principal advised all the students to be of help to................
explanation: The principal advised all the students to be of help to one another

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Mr. Ackon needed..............help to succeed in the business
explanation: Mr. Ackon needed a little help to succeed in the business

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Susan has been urging me to join the..............`
explanation: Susan has been urging me to join the Girls Guide

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Three kilometres...............quite a long distance
explanation: Three kilometres is quite a long distance

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

If they had known us, they..........
explanation: If they had known us, they would not have treated us like that
options: will not treat us like that
would not treat us like that
will not have treated us like that
would not have treated us like that

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The teacher made us.........five poems each.
explanation:
The teacher made us recite five poems each.

Recite; means to repeat aloud or declaim (a poem or passage) from memory before an audience.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Each one of the ten chosen contestants............lunch with patron
explanation:
Each one of the ten chosen contestants has had lunch with patron

Has had is in the past perfect progressive tense. Basically, it indicates an ongoing action in the past, similar to past continuous, that was completed before some other action.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The teacher needs.......to write the note on the chalkboard
explanation: The teacher needs some chalk to write the note on the chalkboard

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Madam Abike turned..........13 bags of maize at the first harvest
explanation: Madam Abike turned out 13 bags of maize at the first harvest

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The teacher, as well as his students...........working very hard.
explanation:
in the rule of concord, when ''as well as'' is used in a sentence the first subject is given more relevance to determine the verb form. 
Therefore, since the first subject is singular (the teacher) the verb must be singular. 

is=singular
have been=plural
are=plural
were=plural

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

My mother remarked that it was high time we..........preparing supper.
explanation:
My mother remarked that it was high time we started preparing supper.

It's (high) time; past subjunctive expresses that something should be done and that it is already a bit late.  As for the structure, it is followed by a subject with a past tense

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

All we need...............dedicated teachers
explanation:
All we need are dedicated teachers

Because the ''teachers'' is plural, are is correct. If the subject was in its singular terms, ''is'' would be used.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Though Yusuf is a much younger lawyer, you cannot compare his eloquence.............his master's
explanation:
Though Yusuf is a much younger lawyer, you cannot compare his eloquence with his master's

With; having or possessing (something).

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

The student wondered why the sun constantly rises..........the east
explanation:
The student wondered why the sun constantly rises from the east

From; indicating the point in space at which a journey, motion, or action starts.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Mrs. Kofi is angry..............her daughter's lack of interest in her business
explanation:
Mrs. Kofi is angry at her daughter's lack of interest in her business.

If directed at a person "angry with" should always be used. If directed at a situation I believe "angry at" would also be acceptable. e.g. I was very angry at how rainy it was. The key is who or what the anger is aimed at. in this regards, its aimed at ''lack of interest"

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

Until I heard him myself, I ................imagined that he said that
explanation:
Until I heard him myself, could not have imagined that he said that.

Could not have means that something was impossible in the past.

question:
From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:

No sooner had war started..............the soldiers deserted the village
explanation:
No sooner had war started than the soldiers deserted the village.

Than; is used in expressions indicating one thing happening immediately after another.

question: In question numbered 96 above, choose the best option from letters A - D that best completes the gap.
